content:
Posted: November 9, 2013
												This is a really great 2D, action, adventure, sandbox game. Before you allow naysayers to make you doubt buying and enjoying this game, consider all the positive reviews first and make sure you gave it a fair chance.When Terraria was first released, I myself had been a Minecraft player. So as you can guess my first thoughts about it were, "Someone made a clone of Minecraft?". However, instead of leaving it at that I decided to actually look into the game and eventually bought it out of curiosity for its 2d side scrolling and simplistic design. I found that Terraria although small when it was first released, was a very fun and addictive game. As the game has received a vast amount of updates the content has changed greatly. It has become a well thought out and a finely crafted game. ;) On a serious note, this game has many features and a variety of content I don't think you will find readily anywhere else in this type of game. You can easily play this game for hours solo or with friends, generating worlds can be wildly different, and to obtain some items you may even have to generate 2 or 3 worlds just to find them. I don't want to spoil anything but please note: You can easily get through the game without having the items that all possible worlds can generate. I mainly want to emphasize that you can play new worlds and continue the adventure. After playing this game for many months I quit for a short while, when I returned to play again, the updates allowed me to create a new world and a new character, and still enjoy the same parts of the game I had played in the past, but now with new mechanics and items and even new npcs.Aside from my personal experiences with this game here are some Pro's and Con's.Pro's:Lots of content for hours of play.Solo or Multi-player options.Tons of items and materials.Many npcs and in game events.Smooth combat system.Creative bosses, monsters, and npcs.Con's:As the world is 2D, buildings tend to be simple and square at first, but can be fully developed thanks to placeable items and back walls. (Check out the screen shots for some awesome builds)The world only generates once based on the size you pick, leaving a finite ammount of materials for one map.Screen shots are a pain to take and paste together to show off large buildings. (Developers have revealed a new update, allowing for larger screen shots. Yay!)Overall there is a lot of content for this game, many items to craft, monsters, and more planned updates. If you like to build, this is a great game with many options to build marvellous structures.If you like to adventure with friends, this is a very fun game to take down bosses together, and build better weapons and armour with the resources you find and earn.Thank you for taking the time to read my review for Terraria, I hope this helps you make the right decision for you, and that you are happy, which ever way you should go. :)

content:
Posted: June 27, 2012
												Now before you dismiss it as a Minecraft clone, here are some reasons why Terraria is better than Minecraft.1. The Amount of ContentThe amount of content is Terraria is astounding for such a simplistic game. As of version 1.2.4 the game contains over 1000 items. This includes tons of weapons, armor, and consumables.2. Low RequirementsMinecraft has low PC requirements, but Terraria requires even less. It is 2D, but don't let that fool you. The game has more than enough content to make up for its limited mobility.3. Play how you Want.Terraria allows for so many different play styles that it could take you forever to try them all. There are no set classes, so if you really want to, you can be a mage riding a hoverboard while firing off a minigun. With the main 3 playstyles focusing on Bows/Guns, Melee, and Magic, your choices are a little limited there, BUT with the amount of armor, accessory, and weapon customization available, you can create a character style that suits your playstyle.4. ChallengeNo good game goes without challenge, and Terraria has it. It's not the level of challenge present in Dark Souls, but it does have decent difficulty, especially after reaching Hard Mode. It encourages reaching new levels of armor and weapons before continuing onward.5. MultiplayerMultiplayer in Terraria is a great way to pass time with a bunch of friends. You can take on crazy events with your friends instead of doing it alone. Not to mention, your character's inventory transfers between worlds, so bring your best character in instead of making another.Overall, a fantastic game, one that is worthy of your time and money.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												 There are so many things in Terraria I can go over but its so much that I cant fit it all on one review, so I will just go over some of the basic things about the game and keep it as breif as I can (I tend to go off on rants when talking about stuff like this, so this may not be very "breif"). Terraria (in the words of nerdcubed) is basicly a 2D Minecraft that focuses more on crafting and dungeon crawling, were as minecraft focuses on creativity and building, with alot more content and things to do. It has a nice pixelated style that is the perfect level for the player to tell what something is and what is going on around them. The aim of the game is to make a house and gradualy progress in the game, upgrading your gear, killing bosses and building a village for the NPCs that move in. This sounds quite a bit like minecraft dont it? Just trust me, they are two very different games.  You've got so many places you can visit, such as the jungle, the dungeon or the beaches at the end of the world. minecrafts scense of scale was bigger than terraria's but in terraria, none of it goes to waste. almost all the biomes that you will find to be useful one way or another. Thats not even mentioning all the other items in the game, each one made for a spisific task. During combat, it feels, with any weapon, satisfying to kill mobs weather its a green slime, zombie or the eye of cthulhu. All the choices of weapons and accessories are very abundant, as well as decritive blocks for building homes and possibley pixel art. I would talk about the NPCs in the game but again, trying to keep it as short as I can. All around, the game Terraria is an awesome experiance that you can even share with your friends with multiplayer. There are very little problems I have with the game. its a low demanding game (computer wise) that has just the right amount of challenge to make it fun. I recomend this game to anyone who likes long survival pixelated type games.

It also has a lot more content and in general is a spectacular game, and I'd recommend it to anyone and everyone, even people who think it's gonna be like Minecraft who don't like Minecraft.This above review is why I nominated it for the 'I thought this game was cool before it won an award' award.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Terraria is a 2D sandbox game. The art style makes it feel like it's a retro game (2x2 pixles). It usually starts off slow, but when it picks up, it gets awesome. With 11 bosses, 3 invasion events, 3 moon events, and a wide variety of normal enemies, this game will keep you playing. There are also a ton of different weapons to kill things with. If you want to be a ranger, you can choose bows, repeaters, guns, or explosives with different ammunition. If you want to be a melee figther, you can choose spears, swords, flails, or boomerangs. Also, if you want to be mage, you can have staffs, spell books, homing projectiles, controllable projectiles, bouncing projectiles, minions, or rain attacks. There's also a lot of collectables, such as statues, clothes, and banners. I personally give this game 10/10 stars.

												250 hours here, and another 500+ on friend's account. BEWARE!This game is a time-eater. Terraria is, far as I know, one of the best side-scrolling sandbox games. You can build, you can mine, craft, destroy. If there are any cons. about this game, then it might be leak of RPG mechanics out of which Terraria got some, for example tiered items give us a little taste of RPG Farming and Leveling up(Here "Gearing up") methods of spending time. If you don't have time for such games, buy it anyway. If you have? Then enjoy this one in all its riches!Over 3000+ items of wide variety of usage, progressively changing map(even if it has limited size), Lots of bosses, monsters and traps are the only few of zillions of advantages you can take of when playing this game.Totally recommended choice. 10 Euro for this amount of content? Waaaaay too cheap. ^^

												"OMG THIS GAME IS HORRIBLE MIENKRAFT IS BETTER IT HAS MOD!!1!11ONE" claims the Minecraft fanboy, as he stomps his feet onto the hard, mahogany floor. "Well, Terraria has mods too, atleast they're executed much more perfectly than those Minecraft mods that attempt to implement RPG/Grindfest influenced content." replies the Terraria fan.Otherwise, as a more serious viewpoint, any time someone uses the "Minecraft having mods" argument against Terraria, they would have to take into account that they're claiming that unpolished RPG-esque mods (Advent of Ascension, DivineRPG, ArcanaRPG) are BETTER than a game that has superior altogether polish, even if the Minecraft fanboy/girl(s) take modpacks into account.While they may also have a say about something such as Thaumcraft and Botania, should they realize that both of which aren't even similar to Terraria at all, and only bear a small amount of content and polish as compared to Terraria itself.Carefully awaiting the storm of spite, frustration and rage to engulf me. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												First of all, I'd like to point out that only saying Terraria is exactly like Minecraft has not played in depth. There is a completely different energy to Terraria which is just perfect for a sandbox. It's peaceful at parts, and quite the opposite at others for instance when fighting one of the many bosses. I have yet to get bored of this game. Terraria in my opinion is worth more than it's current price, so definitely a bargain for such a great game.Also, the whole idea of characters is just perfect. You can have different characters which transfer their items between worlds or servers. It just works really well.I have heard people saying that this game is bad because it doesn't have a creative mode like a lot of other sandboxes, but Terraria really wouldn't suit a creative mode. Not because you can't create very good looking creations, because you certainly can, but it just really wouldn't suit one. If those people played the game properly they would soon see this to be true. Also, I'm sure there is a Terraria mod somewhere to add a creative mode for those of you who may really think it needs it.In conclusion, Terraria is a great game with very few flaws. I'ts completely worth the small price, and anyone who hasn't should really try it out. It also makes a great game for video Let's Plays.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
 Keepin' it simple here. I'm not very good at this game, and I haven't played it much. From the very few hours I've played I can tell you that this game has no replay value whatsoever, and for some reason the graphics are really weird, almost like everything is just little, low quality squares. This game also takes less time than a Call of Duty campaign. Like seriously, this is an open world game based around resources and survival with zombies, flying eyeballs, and killer bunnies but it took less than a night to finish. And I mean a night in game.Jokes aside, I've owned this game for a while and I can tell you it's definitely worth the $10, and it often goes for $2-$3 during Steam sales. So if for some reason you can't afford the 10, the developers very often put it up for sale. After your first world is completed, you'll have the basic memory to complete another world as soon as you want. You can also take any of your characters to any of your generated worlds.  Out of trees for some reason and you don't realize the Dryad sells acorns?  Start a new random world and mow down some trees.Any of the wikipedia websites that exist for Terraria such as http://terraria.wikia.com/wiki/Terraria_Wiki and http://terraria.gamepedia.com/Terraria_Wiki are extremely helpful and I urge any of you newer players to use them. Also the Guide NPC in game can be of great help as annoying as he can be.That's all I'll cover in this review.game is gr8 m8, don't h8, and just r8 it 8/8 and go fish for that lucky gold cr8. smart cursor is your friend

												One of the best games I've ever played, Terraria brings you into a world where literally anything can happen. Mostly. Explore the underground jungle while holding off skeletons and hornets, destroy bosses and get their epic loot, or build towering cities above the clouds. Many people would say " This is a 2D version of Minecraft". Well, they're wrong. This game is original, and is equal or better than Minecraft. I recommend this game to anyone and everyone who has played a sandbox adventure game before or would like to start now!

content:
Posted: September 22, 2013
Terraria ReviewInformation About the GameTerrarai is a 2D platform game in which you create a custom character and enter your own world which can either be small, medium or large. Think mine craft but 2D, you go out an explore and then build, with occasional enemies and bosses to fight along the way.The ReviewI started playing Terraria when a friend told me its a must have game and something to do while the sever we played on was down, when I first got the game I didn't think much of it because everything was either done or I didn't have the equipment to do anything but things changed when I started my own server and explored the world and read all the wiki links(http://terraria.wikia.com/wiki/Terraria_Wiki) on how to build and make euipment. People say Terraira is only fun when your on with friends but in my opinion the games is fun to the extent of you own imagination regardless of friends playing or not. The enemies and bosses can sometimes be a bit overpowered and annoying when your are truing to build and constantly being hit by pixies or the overpowered pinks ones with laser beams.The RatingI would say yes Terraria is a fantastic game even with the new updates but it dose get a bit repetitive if you constantly killing pixies over and over and over again so this does hurt the game a lot and wish for when Terraria 2 comes out that the problem will be dealt with. So in sum Terraria needs a few more things adding to make it one of the greats hopefully Terraria 2 will fix this.Thanks for reading Cash

content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												I found, when I started playing Terraria, that it was like: "Here's a world, now go play." And this really frustrated me. The Guide isn't the brightest bulb in the box, but atleast in 1.3 he can shoot arrows. But once I had discovered the Terraria Wiki,I found this game was really fun! Building in Terraria is incredibly well done, the combat system has a few flaws, but it's very entertaining. But most of all, just the pure gameplay. Can you think of a 2D platformer, where you are raiding a lost jungle temple, where your weapon is a wasp shooting gun, and your grappling hook is slimey. WOW. And this is the start.The whole battle aspect of the game is very enriching, when paired with the music. You can battle martians with a LAZER MACHINE GUN, kill pirates with a NYAN CAT SWORD, kill a goblin army with a SNOWMAN CANNON, or kill a rain of slime and their king with a SANDGUN.I love this game.All I have to say, is that you have to get this game

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												So I figured that I would sit and write a review after 800 hours of playing this game. And then 1.3 came out and there went another 200+ hours... So it's not like Terraria needs the reviews, but I just feel the need to give it the ol Thumbs Up cuz it's really freakin good. The English language doesn't have a word for it, but I beleive the Japanese do, and I don't remember it. The Possiblities and variations this game creates are so good that I now look for games to buy on steam comparing each one to Terraria and realizing that nothing will ever measure up to Terraria. It has the most content. The best procedrally generated worlds. Tons of enemies and bosses to fight. And with 1.3 it even has a bit of a story line (but not really cuz there is 0 dialogue to support a story line, except the idea that you are the hero of the world. But that's okay cuz the story is so good it doesn't need one).Plus Multiplayer....... In most games saying mp is the same as sp can be seen as negative. In Terraria that is so not the case. For each player on a world armies and legions and moons spawn more enemies. I am freaking out right now just trying to put the excitement into words.But Jack "Dingus" Douglas managed to put it like this:"If you want to be in the best shape of your life, go to a gym.If you want be a look like a great god, nah, kill a great god, buy" this "Program."

content:
Posted: July 15, 2013
												My very first thought was: this gotta be a Minecraft clone in 2D. I like minecraft, so why shouldnt i give this one a chance? Plus, i like Platformers, so how could i get wrong?To be honest, my first impression was a really bad one. After creating a detailed character for your adventure and choosing the world's size, you're dropped in a landscape with nothing but a guy next to you called "guide". The Guide gives you a few random tips, but only the first 4 or 5 are really usefull. Since the game does not provide any other form or tutorial, your first instinct is to read through all the tips. After around half of them you'll be totally confused and they'll stop making sense to someone who just played the game. The basic mechanisms of the game, such as crafting (which is REALLY essential) are not explained in detail. I had to watch tutorials on youtube in order to understand how to get started. Since there is a huge community for this game, it was not hard to find a good tutorial in no time. Still i dont think this is how it should be.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Terraria is a 2D sandbox game. The art style makes it feel like it's a retro game (2x2 pixles). It usually starts off slow, but when it picks up, it gets awesome. With 11 bosses, 3 invasion events, 3 moon events, and a wide variety of normal enemies, this game will keep you playing. There are also a ton of different weapons to kill things with. If you want to be a ranger, you can choose bows, repeaters, guns, or explosives with different ammunition. If you want to be a melee figther, you can choose spears, swords, flails, or boomerangs. Also, if you want to be mage, you can have staffs, spell books, homing projectiles, controllable projectiles, bouncing projectiles, minions, or rain attacks. There's also a lot of collectables, such as statues, clothes, and banners. I personally give this game 10/10 stars.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												 There are so many things in Terraria I can go over but its so much that I cant fit it all on one review, so I will just go over some of the basic things about the game and keep it as breif as I can (I tend to go off on rants when talking about stuff like this, so this may not be very "breif"). Terraria (in the words of nerdcubed) is basicly a 2D Minecraft that focuses more on crafting and dungeon crawling, were as minecraft focuses on creativity and building, with alot more content and things to do. It has a nice pixelated style that is the perfect level for the player to tell what something is and what is going on around them. The aim of the game is to make a house and gradualy progress in the game, upgrading your gear, killing bosses and building a village for the NPCs that move in. This sounds quite a bit like minecraft dont it? Just trust me, they are two very different games.  You've got so many places you can visit, such as the jungle, the dungeon or the beaches at the end of the world. minecrafts scense of scale was bigger than terraria's but in terraria, none of it goes to waste. almost all the biomes that you will find to be useful one way or another. Thats not even mentioning all the other items in the game, each one made for a spisific task. During combat, it feels, with any weapon, satisfying to kill mobs weather its a green slime, zombie or the eye of cthulhu. All the choices of weapons and accessories are very abundant, as well as decritive blocks for building homes and possibley pixel art. I would talk about the NPCs in the game but again, trying to keep it as short as I can. All around, the game Terraria is an awesome experiance that you can even share with your friends with multiplayer. There are very little problems I have with the game. its a low demanding game (computer wise) that has just the right amount of challenge to make it fun. I recomend this game to anyone who likes long survival pixelated type games.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2012
												Now before you dismiss it as a Minecraft clone, here are some reasons why Terraria is better than Minecraft.1. The Amount of ContentThe amount of content is Terraria is astounding for such a simplistic game. As of version 1.2.4 the game contains over 1000 items. This includes tons of weapons, armor, and consumables.2. Low RequirementsMinecraft has low PC requirements, but Terraria requires even less. It is 2D, but don't let that fool you. The game has more than enough content to make up for its limited mobility.3. Play how you Want.Terraria allows for so many different play styles that it could take you forever to try them all. There are no set classes, so if you really want to, you can be a mage riding a hoverboard while firing off a minigun. With the main 3 playstyles focusing on Bows/Guns, Melee, and Magic, your choices are a little limited there, BUT with the amount of armor, accessory, and weapon customization available, you can create a character style that suits your playstyle.4. ChallengeNo good game goes without challenge, and Terraria has it. It's not the level of challenge present in Dark Souls, but it does have decent difficulty, especially after reaching Hard Mode. It encourages reaching new levels of armor and weapons before continuing onward.5. MultiplayerMultiplayer in Terraria is a great way to pass time with a bunch of friends. You can take on crazy events with your friends instead of doing it alone. Not to mention, your character's inventory transfers between worlds, so bring your best character in instead of making another.Overall, a fantastic game, one that is worthy of your time and money.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2013
												Its worth paying for. Terraria is a wide game if you give the time for it.I think many people who have JUST heard of Terraria may think its a Minecraft but 2D. Some of them are right, but are also wrong too.The Plot:I wouldn't really say a plot is in Terraria. How i would put it is like this:You arrived in a land, alien to what it normally is, around you is wood, water, a man, and varoius landscapes. Your move.Gameplay:This is the games beef. All the weapons and gear you find is intresting. some of them refrence games, like Pixel Piracy. some armor and vanity wear does too. The building in Terraria is also a great aspect. adding minecarts, and wire for electricity. You can nearly build anything you want. In 2D of course.Graphically it does not shine honestly, but graphics are not everything to a game. But honestly, the combat is solid, yeah its point and click but it feels so satisfying when you swing your sword and the guts of a zombie fly away. The Bosses do prove a challenge to the new player. I mean when I fought the Eye of Cthulhu yeah i was like: "OH GOD WHAT DO I DO!?" but then the first few bosses do teach you to use what you got honestly. If you play A Link to Terraria, which honestly is a great map if you like Zelda and Terraria. But back to the game.Protecting your land is a important part if you want to keep your NPC's safe too, since there are invasion battles like the goblin army. I personally take it as an endurance round. Cause thats what it basically is.Overall, if i had to rate Terraria. it would be a 9/10I'll re-edit this for 1.3! :D

content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												Rewriting bio, though nothing has changed. This game is spectacular. Now, here's really why - The game technically got "finished" as Red, the creator, moved on to Terraria: Otherworld, it's somewhat-of-a-sequel. Some Terraria devs stayed behind however, and still are updating it.I love this game in the few years I've had it, and it's definitely my second most played game on Steam as of now.If you want a basic review, in a nutshell it's 2D Minecraft IF the actual devs stayed behind to work on Minecraft. It also has a lot more content and in general is a spectacular game, and I'd recommend it to anyone and everyone, even people who think it's gonna be like Minecraft who don't like Minecraft.This above review is why I nominated it for the 'I thought this game was cool before it won an award' award.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												It's a really good game, thousands of hours of content 110+ hours in and I still find items that I never heard of in the wiki.Review here:Terraria puts you in a world with a few crappy tools- I mean COPPER tools; and then you see a nice peaceful land with green grass, tall trees, butterflies, bunnies, and ponds. But then you chop down a tree and a bunny comes into the axe, and is then, murdered, then you know that crap gets real now, there is no escape. You gather some more wood then proceed to build a house, because you went too far and saw bloody/purple evil land with monsters that that took the crap out of you. After your glorious house is finished, it gets dark, and zombies and eyeballs and lions oh my! appear, You bunker down in your house and watch as your guide friend gets ripped apart by monsters.That is day one. Good luckPros and Cons (I love these)Pros+ Lots of bosses+ Lots of areas+ Lots of weapon types+ Lots of classes you can play as+ Lots of area+ Lots of enemies+ Lots of NPCs+ Lots of blocks+ Lots of interesting items+ Lots of character customization+ Lots of armour+ Lots of extras-boosts-items-trinkets-accssessories things+ Lots of dru- Potions+ Lots of content+ Lots of LotsCons- I wasted my life on this, you should tooBottom line, Buy it 11/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2014
												Terraria is a 2D sandbox game. The art style makes it feel like it's a retro game (2x2 pixles). It usually starts off slow, but when it picks up, it gets awesome. With 11 bosses, 3 invasion events, 3 moon events, and a wide variety of normal enemies, this game will keep you playing. There are also a ton of different weapons to kill things with. If you want to be a ranger, you can choose bows, repeaters, guns, or explosives with different ammunition. If you want to be a melee figther, you can choose spears, swords, flails, or boomerangs. Also, if you want to be mage, you can have staffs, spell books, homing projectiles, controllable projectiles, bouncing projectiles, minions, or rain attacks. There's also a lot of collectables, such as statues, clothes, and banners. I personally give this game 10/10 stars.

content:
Posted: February 2
												When I first bought Terraria a few years back, I was not a huge fan of the game. I was about 13 years old, and I was much more interested in Minecraft and thought this game was dumb. Now that I've had the time to play it with my good buddies, I've came to realise that this game is amazing. It has more weapons and classes and many features that Minecraft lacks. Swords have many different abilities, such as some close range and some ranged. The multiplayer works great, but the only complaint is that occasionally others have connection issues and causes a re-host. When I first reviewed this, a gave it a thumbs down, mainly because I was 13, didn't know how to play the game, and it had not seemed interesting. Now, I reccomend anyone to try this game. Get some friends to play with you, and have fun with it. Trust me.

Posted: November 22, 2016
												2D minecraft? Nope!Terraria is a sandbox game where you can build in a 2D world. It is very similar to Minecraft's "survival" genre, but it does not offer the same gameplay features. Terraria is filled with many types of NPCs, some of which are interactive.The crafting system is also different, but also very good. You don't have to spend time searching crafting recipes, but simply have the required items to make an item and viola, the recipe would popup and you'd craft things quickly.

												Terraria is a total ripoff and copy of minecraft...Enemies? MinecraftCollecting resources? MinecraftIt even has Day and Night cycles! this game is just one big ripoff!Jokes aside, Terraria is a very fun and addictive game with endless possibilities. There is a nearly endless amount of weapons, armor, enemies, and content in the game. So much content infact there maybe be things you never even heard about! Terraria singleplayer is fun and addictive, but multiplayer, 2 words, OH. MY. GOD. multiplayer is one of the most fun things in the galaxy, no scratch that, its one of the most funnest thing in the universe. One of the highlights of multiplayer are the funny and stupid deaths of your comrades. Another highlight are the boss fights, their quick and hectic and may be challenging, This game is just so fun, i can spend over a million hours on it yet I still won't be bored! What are you doing!? Go buy this game! Now! It's very cheap too! Get ready to be sucked into a world of exploration, into a world of endless possibilities!

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												The game is fun, you can build stuff, grind good weapons and kill bosses and then it endsalso mods. good fun mods.if you like that stuff buy itnow I'll write a review for the game Second Life(the thumbs up is for terraria)-----------Second Life Review-----------I was exploring the depths of youtube when I come across a very interesting video about a game called second life, and as I'm not such a roleplayer and all that stuff, I turned it away, but seeing as curiosity to see what cancerous adventure layed inside, I gave it a try, only to be greeted by a very small game, which as I thought would lag me and my friend to the next dimension (I want to say sorry for having you see what it held, friend), a world which gave you freedom to do what you wanted----if doing what you wanted meant being a woman peeing in a pole in the middle of the park in the way a man pees.I explored a random land which me and my friend got invited to, and as it loaded, I walked around with bad movement controls and a fixed camera which disturbed me the most. I then saw a group of people. They were dancing. Me and friend approached the group, our in-game names being YamIplayingthis and CancerGod, we observed as people danced and talked. I said nothing, as I did not know how to turn off the all talk option, only to discover then and tell my friend how ♥♥♥♥ed up that was. We saw people talking and acting like it was their lives. their entire lives. they dated, loved, danced, I don't know what people do in real life, but they did there. I saw before my eyes what it was like to abandon real life to live in the matrix as your own avatar, and the worst is, not stopping. The name of the game is exactly what it is, a second life, a life you choose to live in the place of your real one, I don't know why I'm writing a review of Second Life at a Terraria Review, but I'm, and I'm here to tell you, whoever came across this, don't play it, it's too much cancer10/10 would gain more 4 cancer tumours

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 5, 2013
												Terraria is a unique milestone in the evolution of the RPG/sandbox genre. It does contain many of the familiar elements present in such games: digging tunnels, building bases, crafting items, and fighting monsters. However, It ascends above its predecessors by defining a much clearer goal and purpose, emphasizing combat and exploration. Randomized worlds give you plenty of areas to explore, while dungeons and bosses offer unique challenges for you to conquer. Building and mining can give more than just shelter and resources, as you can construct tactical fields or arenas that can cripple your enemies or give you the upper hand in battle. Hundreds of items and gear can be mixed and matched to create a unique character all your own. The sheer amount of content in this game is enough to keep you engaged for a good hundred or so hours.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2016
												IntroductionTerraria is a game developed by Re-Logic. The dev team are very active with this game, constantly supporting and adding to the experience, they are really great developers.GameplayTerraria is a sandox 2D adventure game that focuses mainly on exploration, building and combat. It starts in a procedurally generated world where the player is left with basic items to start the adventure and try to succeed in a very hostile and at times, unforgiving world.In Terraria you will encounter many different enemy types from little slimes to huge mechanical bosses that are not easy to take down. The player can use melee, ranged or summoner to take out these beasts and the HUGE range of items and item recipes/combinations makes the game highly replayable.Players house and interact with NPCs in order to progress through the world, with the first NPC being the Guide, whom can be used constantly to reveal all of the item recipes in the game.Lastly, once you have become good at combat, you can try to become good at building, which adds a whole new element to the game, adding even more hours to your game time. You can build structures high up into the air that take up the whole background, or you can just build a simple lil house to go to sometimes in between fighting bosses, it's completely up to you!Pros+ Endless game time+ Awesome weapons/items/enemies+ Constant dev supportCons- No REAL Story (you make your own adventure)- Online Multiplayer is too laggyResult / Final thoughtsFor a game so inexpensive that can produce sooooo many hours of gameplay, it is crazy value for money. You won’t be disappointed by Terraria. It is my second most played game of all time (and I'm a Final Fantasy completionist enthusiast) and definitely one of my top 10 games of all time!-MC

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Terraria is... probably one of those games about which little more needs to be said, but much like Minecraft, it was definitely what the gaming community wanted, exactly when they wanted it. Unlike Minecraft, which doesn't really shine except for the amazing variety of mods and modpacks created for it, Terraria still stands out among the many games made to follow up on it, with tons of building variety and solid gameplay mechanics.Highly recommended if you want to get into the 2D subgenre of block-building and somehow haven't yet. I wouldn't really write a review for something I feel almost everyone knows well, in general, but I personally nominated this for the “Just 5 More Minutes” Award in the 2016 Steam Awards, because it's a game I've played for just shy of 200 hours, the most of anything I've played on Steam. It's addictive, even for someone like me who much prefers seeing what their friends build to actually building things.

content:
Posted: January 18
												There is only one other game on my list I have played more than Terraria.And that says a lot. Terraria is one of the most fun games I have ever played and I have always felt it was super cheap for the many hours (of addictive fun) I spent playing it.At the basis this is a fantasy RPG-style hack & slay 2D game where you will farm resources and explore the world underground to collect both weapons and items, to craft and upgrade your weapons, gear, and improve your house with essential tools and workbenches, The reason for this is, is because you are essentially always working towards killing the next mini-boss, after having killed the previous. Untill finally the last boss has been reached and defeated.The game has a lot of elements of repetition: you will spend many hours farming resources, and rebattling certain mini-bosses to get as many of a certain resource needed to either upgrade or craft a weapon or armourpiece.All of this is set in a very vibrant and ''cutesy/cartoony'' world, with an interesting back story to why it is you do the things you do (Yes, there actually is some lore). The world is also changeable and will change according to the stages you have reached by killing certain mini-bosses (the difficulty increases once as the game progresses).While you play, according to the actions you take and the available amounts of 'rooms' in your buildings, you will attract all sorts of NPCs, that will help you improve your weapons and gear, sell fun items, or sell items to decorate and build your houses with.There are multiple gamemodes and also multiple modes surrounding your death. You can either opt to lose nothing and have no penalty whatsoever upon death, choose to lose items and money, or go the extreme and have a gameover on death.

												Terraria is a really fun game to play with a bunch of friends online or when friends come over. content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
												\\I Highly reccomend this game for people who are interested in buying an Indie, Sandbox Game. As a Gamer with 1000+ Hours on it, I know firsthand There are certain people who would highly enjoy the elements of this game such as Physics Breaking, and Defying Logic. I do suggest getting this game when it goes on sale, but overall, a high-quality game for when you are bored, looking to build awesome 2d-ish builings and sculptures, or wanting to legitamately beat a game, this is definitetly the game for you.From Forests and Oceans, to Going to Hell and Living Mushrooms, there's lots of fun in this 2d-ish, 16 bit pixel hack-and-slash-and-explore game. You might also LEARN something besides proper grammar and spelling, such as different metals and ore values, and how you can edit your house to fit your expectations. This game will be fun for the whole family as the multiplayer option is built in so you can connect with other people around the world! With tons of loot to find, bosses to slay, events to conquer, and weapons to find, craft, or collect, and many different enemies, Such as Zombies and Spiders, and even a Giant Bee!Classes are a thing, but aren't your MMORPG Linear Classes. Certain Aspects of the game are either harder or easier depending on your items. Aspects like Mining depend on your Pickaxe and armor, which can increase mining speed and power. There are many other aspects such as combat, building, and travel. Mounts can make travel faster, and merchants can sell items to affect your placement speed. Accessories can be combined and shown off as vanity.Please excuse my Habits of the Dual Slash ( \\ ) and the spaces in between Quotes, astericks, and Parentheticals. Join in the Fun and games with the Bloodright Bastion, of which is not only used for a Last Stand, but to also game, have fun, ( And Drink maybe ), and hang out!Want a Hotlink? Here ya go! -> https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Bloodright-Ascension

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2016
												What could I say that hasn't been said? Nothing, but I still will. But first, let me tell you why I'm writing this here: It's been more than five years after the release, AND I STILL GOT SOME FREE CONTENT UPDATE! In a time where games don't even get finished this here gem is the role model. Terraria is kinda for everybody. I have a pal, he plays this game and builds awesome stuff with all the different blocks this game has to offer. Of course, it's less impressive than stuff you see online, but he obviously grows. And it's super simple - you decide what you want to build, you pick a color and you place it. I've seen this pal make a nice lake-side cottage the first two hours into the game.For him, it's Architectaria.My girlfriend just loves smashing stuff in video games. She smashes pots, zombies, antlions, small flying eyes, big flying eyes, fish, spiders. She just builds basic boxes for houses and ventures onto her smashing adventure. And she loves all the gibs that fly off from dead monsters.For her, it's Killaria.I, myself sometimes love to grind for loot. I can spend four, five, six hours killing that big fluffy bee go get that flying mount drop for my collection. And I also like stylizing and decorating houses for different NPCs. I just adore building an artificial flying island and placing a wrecked ship there just for one pirate NPC to live there.For me - it's Designaria and Grindaria.Terra means Earth, as in planet Earth. Combining all those "rarias" you'd probably get Terraria, as a world of possibilities, for everybody and anybody.Except for those who hate platforming. And pixels.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2013
												Terraria is a unique milestone in the evolution of the RPG/sandbox genre. It does contain many of the familiar elements present in such games: digging tunnels, building bases, crafting items, and fighting monsters. However, It ascends above its predecessors by defining a much clearer goal and purpose, emphasizing combat and exploration. Randomized worlds give you plenty of areas to explore, while dungeons and bosses offer unique challenges for you to conquer. Building and mining can give more than just shelter and resources, as you can construct tactical fields or arenas that can cripple your enemies or give you the upper hand in battle. Hundreds of items and gear can be mixed and matched to create a unique character all your own. The sheer amount of content in this game is enough to keep you engaged for a good hundred or so hours.

Posted: March 7, 2016
												"OMG THIS GAME IS HORRIBLE MIENKRAFT IS BETTER IT HAS MOD!!1!11ONE" claims the Minecraft fanboy, as he stomps his feet onto the hard, mahogany floor. "Well, Terraria has mods too, atleast they're executed much more perfectly than those Minecraft mods that attempt to implement RPG/Grindfest influenced content." replies the Terraria fan.Otherwise, as a more serious viewpoint, any time someone uses the "Minecraft having mods" argument against Terraria, they would have to take into account that they're claiming that unpolished RPG-esque mods (Advent of Ascension, DivineRPG, ArcanaRPG) are BETTER than a game that has superior altogether polish, even if the Minecraft fanboy/girl(s) take modpacks into account.While they may also have a say about something such as Thaumcraft and Botania, should they realize that both of which aren't even similar to Terraria at all, and only bear a small amount of content and polish as compared to Terraria itself.Carefully awaiting the storm of spite, frustration and rage to engulf me. Thus removing all my flesh with the sharp, white stones of minor size piercing my flesh via moving at high velocities.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												This very probably is one of the giants amongst steam games; Despite seeming to be such a simple, and basic 2D platformer game, it has provided hundreds of hours of fun to myself, along with several of my best friends. The game is really well balanced, continues to receive updates (Even after a year-long scare from the developer who claimed the updates would stop), has a plethora of bosses, loot, craftable items, NPCS, a balanced trading system, thousands of craftable items, blocks, etc... Its a perfect blend of platformer, and sandbox; where you can build just about anything you want, including a rudimentary circuitry system, as well as fight some of the most obscenely hard enemies known to platformer-styled games. All in all, this game is so good, I've even bought it for a few of my friends, and just gave it to them, so that I'd have the opportunity to enjoy the game with them.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2012
												One of the most intruiging side scrolling sandbox games I have ever played. Terraria was first released Monday, May 16th, 2011 on Steam and it has come a long way since then. You have the ability to shape your world with materials found high and low. They have even implemented a toggle switch for PvP for those players who want to play with friends or friends of friends with or without a massacre. There are sky islands to explore all the way to the depths of a hellish place filled with demons and a few monstrous creatures. For those of you who like playing with your friends, a multiplayer server is easily set up without the use of any other program besides the game client. I've had tons of fun playing this game and you should do the same.

												"Minecraft is a sandbox game with RPG elements, Terraria is an RPG game with sandbox elements."Not sure who said that, but it's true.Okay, Terraria may not be 3D, but it makes up for that in a lot of other places.For instance, the variety of weapons and enemies, and the depth of the ground.It's not a Minecraft clone, but there's some resemblances.For instance, both games revolve around mining, and using the materials you've gained from that to craft items you need.However, Terraria is much more focused on the RPG aspect; it has many different enemies, even MORE different types of weapons, and a lot of bosses and things to explore and enjoy.tl;drIt may not look like Crysis, but I sure had a lot of fun playing this!

I definitly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
AUDIODecentVISUALCuteDIFFICULTYRangesVIBECreativeCRAVINGExpansivenessON SALEFrequentlyUPDATE: Holy hell, what a patch! This game has shot up from a 7/10 to a 9/10! New baddies, new items, bugs fixed, what a game!PROS: Terraria is excellently-priced for the amount of content and multiplayer fun you'll be getting out of it. Customization in your character and base is extensive and gameplay can be augmented with items that give particular abilities. Characters retain equipment and inventory across servers, so no starting over just because you want a new map. Enemies are highly varied and fascinating to learn about.CONS: You'll be dropped in a world with little direction. It's not quite "Don't Starve" levels of self-taught gameplay, but if this feature is more frustrating than rewarding, you will need to open up the Terraria wiki immediately. With such deep caverns, you may find yourself away from the overworld longer than what's comfortable or necessary; choose between the long trek back or a bruteish vertical shaft to jump upwards on for five minutes. Server troubles were present last time I hosted, though this may have changed in the past year. Character system can be easily abused to destroy maps on public servers.WORTH: It's constantly going on sale for very cheap, so consider the 4-pack if you plan to play.OVERALL: It may not be the multiplayer game you dedicate the next two years to, but Terraria is a joy to be shared with others.                                                     SCORE: 9/10

content:
Posted: June 11, 2012
												"Minecraft is a sandbox game with RPG elements, Terraria is an RPG game with sandbox elements."Not sure who said that, but it's true.Okay, Terraria may not be 3D, but it makes up for that in a lot of other places.For instance, the variety of weapons and enemies, and the depth of the ground.It's not a Minecraft clone, but there's some resemblances.For instance, both games revolve around mining, and using the materials you've gained from that to craft items you need.However, Terraria is much more focused on the RPG aspect; it has many different enemies, even MORE different types of weapons, and a lot of bosses and things to explore and enjoy.tl;drIt may not look like Crysis, but I sure had a lot of fun playing this!

												This is an anti-feminist game!  There are many signs that PROVE this theory!  On Blood Moons (a seemingly monthly event in the game) the women NPC's get irritable!  Are you saying ALL women get mad on their cycles?!  You are putting us women in a stereotype!  The nurse is female.  She is expected to just heal you whenever, and even other male NPC's have crushes on her!  That's basically R A P E : a horrible thing to have in a game.  One thing I'm glad for in this game is that the trees look like male genitals and us women can chop them down and destroy their power.  Men get everything else.  The tinkerer is male.  Are the developers saying I can't tinker?  Not only this but there are SO many missing options!  There seems to be no "vegan setting" in the game.  Why is it so easy to kill animals?  You capture poor animals in a net against their will and you can eat them too! It's not even like you cook the poor animals either, your playable character eats it raw like a feral cavewoman!  Another missing option is the lack of non-binary gender choices.  What if I do not want to sound like a man OR a woman when I get hurt?  And I'm sorry but the women sound like they're explicitly moaning when they get hit.  This means that the developers are masochistic and think that us women like it.  I will not tolerate abuse in this household and I would NEVER let my children play this game, in case it influences them.  Why are females even allowed to be damaged?!  There is no variety of religion in this game.  NO VARIETY.  The only religions are those weird solar reptile things and the lunar cultists.  You can go in the reptile thing's temple and massacre them!  History is repeating itself.  What if I'm a Jew?  I want to fit in somewhere in the game instead of being oppressed.  Take out both the golem and the Moon Lord!  Speaking of the Moon Lord, why is it male?  Why not female?  MEN DON'T CONTROL EVERYTHING!!!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												I played this game for quite long time non - steam and now I regret it, cuz it'd add a lot more hours in game to my current amount. I bought it so I can also play with friends + achievements.So basically most of ppl say it's a 2D Minecraft... I don't think so. It's WAY more expanded than mc. Tons of items (since 1.3 update there's like 3,5k items in game), 29 bosses (including minibosses), 400+ enemies, different biomes. You can be anyone in this game! A builder, a warrior, an explorer. You can ride an unicorn mount, using a damn yoyo, while fighting against the Moon Lord. There's nothing you can't do! Soundtrack is fantastic! I liked every single track, they're very well made, fitting with environments. You can even record any music track with a music box and then equip it as your accessory, to let you listen to it whenever you want to.This game costs 10 bucks and only 'dlc' that you can buy is official soundtrack. Everytime the game gets updated you can access the new content for free and that's what I love in this game. Because updates are solid, well made and they download in 2-3 minutes top (unless it's a major update like 1.3). Sometimes I wanna make a donation to developers just to show them that I fully support their incredible work. Still waiting for Terraria:Otherworld though. I rate this game 10/10, I got everything and even more of what I'd expect from such a game. I highly recommend this game to anyone who hasn't tried it yet.I swear, I didn't write this review just for new badge. I had an idea from some time in my mind. Figured out that now would be a good time for a review for this game. ^^
